title: Allow Kayn to pick what form he becomes
body: While I like the concept, in terms of actual gameplay it can be a bit of a hindrance. Even if the enemy team comp is mostly ranged, my own team comp may be better off with additional CC.  It feels particularly restrict to wait an additional 3 minutes, particularly in such a rapidly paced game.

replies.body: Just wait, seriously. Clear your camps, gank a lane or two if you can, maybe get an objective like Dragon or scuttle if you haven't already. By then you should have passed the needed 3 minutes.

> [{quoted}](name=Gakupo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LIEd6EJ2,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-16T23:25:54.862+0000)
>
> Just wait, seriously. Clear your camps, gank a lane or two if you can, maybe get an objective like Dragon or scuttle if you haven't already. By then you should have passed the needed 3 minutes.

Kayn is a champion who gains the majority of his power from his transformation. Assuming that the game runs for 30 minutes, this is 10% more of the game where his powerspike is being delayed.  That is particularly severe, and this increases more as most games generally tend to be shorter over time.

Furthermore, your suggestion is rather poor.  Do you believe a Kayn player would remain in fountain for 3 minutes? O_o  I question the severity of your advice, as it is something which would already be occurring.

If you're sitting around waiting for the timer to hit, then yeah I would imagine you're doing nothing but staring at the timer. If the Kayn is good, he can survive the 4 minutes to transform into Raast/Shadow Assassin while getting work done that he would've done even if he transfomed.

Heck, it doesn't even take that long TO transform in the first place, the quickest I could find in the jungle was about 6 minutes, 40 seconds. If you can manage that every game, and your team is just so behind that you can't wait an extra 4 minutes... might need to question what you and/or your team has been doing.

And thank you Vyniadus, I don't play Kayn so I wasn't aware it was actually 4 minutes.

> [{quoted}](name=Gakupo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LIEd6EJ2,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-17T12:49:31.735+0000)
>
> If you're sitting around waiting for the timer to hit, then yeah I would imagine you're doing nothing but staring at the timer.

Which no one is doing so why even make this statement dude?

 >If the Kayn is good, he can survive the 4 minutes to transform into Raast/Shadow Assassin while getting work done that he would've done even if he transfomed.


Which has absolutely no relevancy to what I stated. Your solution is literally "Keep doing what you've been doing while waiting 4minutes."  That isn't at all productiveand is hardly a suggestion.

> 
> Heck, it doesn't even take that long TO transform in the first place, the quickest I could find in the jungle was about 6 minutes, 40 seconds. If you can manage that every game, and your team is just so behind that you can't wait an extra 4 minutes... might need to question what you and/or your team has been doing.

Okay aaaand again, this doesn't address anything that I have stated.
My statement "I think it would be good if Kayn can choose his transformation rather than wait an extra 4 minutes for a transformation he would possess anyway."

Your statement "Well you earn your transformation in X, and you should be doing Y while you wait the 4 minutes."  This doesn't address the concern at all, it is literally dancing around the actual subject at hand.  SO I can't really refute something that is literally summarized as

"Do what you've been doing already."

Like... if you had said "It doesn't really hurt Kayn to wait an extra 4 minutes." that would be a bit more substantial.

> [{quoted}](name=Vyniadus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LIEd6EJ2,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-07-17T00:36:28.096+0000)
>
> Why is there all this talk about 3 minutes, the lockout duration is 4 minutes? Anyways, I main Kayn and currently there is no need to change him in any way. Something else about Kayn would probably have to be nerfed if you made his powerspike more reliable.

4 minutes, pardon.
Why would it need to be nerfed anyway? His powerspike would remain the same, it would merely be a QoL change.
Mind you, this wouldn't buff Kayn, it would merely be providing him what he will achieve anyway.  
It was also introduced at one point on the PBE but Riot never went through with it for some reason.

Why is there all this talk about 3 minutes, the lockout duration is 4 minutes? Anyways, I main Kayn and currently there is no need to change him in any way. Something else about Kayn would probably have to be nerfed if you made his powerspike more reliable.
